result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Atty Firkus states he's received and reviewed discovery. Atty Firkus updates the Court on DE's ATR status asking to schedule this out.  ADA Becker agrees, request to schedule mid November. Court prefers to have DE appear in person. Adjourned at 4:25 PM. bph

records.addlTxt:
11:03  AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Melissa Marie Crocker in court.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Melissa Marie Crocker.  Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court also calls 22CF616- Michael Kirland in court in custody,  Atty Phillip Helgeson for DE in court.   Atty Satorius states DE is willing to waive PH and believes Mr. Kirland is also planning to waive PH.  As to 22CF615- Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Atty Satorius states they would like to continue with ARGN.  ADA Ellenwood states the information will mirror complaint. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG on all 5 counts.  State to provide all discovery within the next 20 days, motions to be filed 20 days after that. Atty Satorius believes this matter will be resolved soon, asking to schedule PLEAS. Tina Sitz from JSC is here, states DE has not done any testing at this time. As to 22CF616-  Atty Helgeson states he believes he has a conflict and will need to be taken off this case. Atty Helgeson states DE is planning to waive PH.  Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.   Atty Helgeson would like to proceed to ARGN for today. State will file information that mirrors complaint.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG's entered.  DE is on PO hold.  Atty Helgeson requesting to convert bond to signature. DE verified address and phone number.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 11:19 AM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 04:15 pm.

AMENDED 

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.
Pre-trial conference on October 25, 2022 at 04:15 pm.

State agrees to bond modification.  Cash maintains bond until PH has been held.  Atty Helgeson to update court if DE's bed becomes available before next court date. Adjourned at 3:13 PM. bph

1:19 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K. Anderson,  Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin, Attorney Stephanie Kay Schmidt and Intern Lanie Krause in court, Defendant Michael James Kirkland in court, in custody. Court reviews file. Court notes DE did not qualify for public defender. Court finds good cause to extend time limits for preliminary hearing. DE states that he filed PFAC this morning. Court will review PFAC as soon as it is received. DE requests bond modification, Court notes this is a Branch III case and will need to be modified by Branch III. Court resets BBH. Adjourned. kma
